decision_conditions: It is recommended that the lapsed Beech hedging can be reduce by 30% in line with existing Leylandii hedge to rear, and cut back Beech overhanging shed in far right hand corner so to formalise as a hedge, Weeping willow tree in far left hand corner overall crown reduction of 30% and crown lift 5m as general maintenance and allow light in to the garden. these trees are in the rear garden of 34 Reed Pond Walk which is within the Gidea Park Conservation Area.

Anyone who takes, damages or destroys the nest of any wild bird whilst that nest is in use or being built is guilty of an offence under the Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 and prior to commencing work you should ensure that no nesting birds will be affected.

Please note that if the work for which consent is granted is not carried out within 2 years of the date of this letter, it will be necessary to submit a fresh application if it is intended to implement the work.
description: lapsed Beech hedging reduce by 30% in line with existing Leylandii hedge to rear, and cut back Beech overhang to shed in far right hand corner to formalise as a hedge, Weeping willow tree in far left hand corner overall crown reduction of 30% and crown lift 5m as general maintenance and allow light in to the garden
